{"step_by_step_thinking": "During a parotidectomy, the parotid gland is removed. The parotid gland is innervated by the facial nerve. Therefore, if the patient feels numbness while shaving after a parotidectomy, it suggests involvement of the facial nerve. The facial nerve provides sensory innervation to the skin of the face, including the area where shaving occurs.", "answer_choice": "A. Facial"}
